When it comes to setting the wake-up period for the Philips Wake-Up Light, it's generally recommended to start with a shorter period and gradually increase it as your body adjusts. Here's why:

**Starting with a shorter wake-up period:**

1. **Easier adjustment**: A shorter wake-up period, such as 15 minutes, can be less overwhelming for your body and make it easier to adjust to the new wake-up time.
2. **Gradual adjustment**: By starting with a shorter period, you can gradually increase the duration as your body adjusts to the new wake-up time, making it easier to establish a consistent wake-up routine.
3. **Reduced sleep inertia**: A shorter wake-up period can help reduce sleep inertia, which is the feeling of grogginess and disorientation that can occur when waking up.

**Increasing the wake-up period:**

1. **Improved wake-up experience**: As you adjust to the shorter wake-up period, you can gradually increase the duration to 30 minutes or more, which can lead to a more gentle and natural wake-up experience.
2. **Better sleep quality**: A longer wake-up period can help improve sleep quality by allowing your body to wake up more naturally, which can lead to better restorative sleep and increased energy levels.
3. **Increased flexibility**: With a longer wake-up period, you can have more time to relax, stretch, meditate, or enjoy a cup of coffee before starting your day.

**Tips for adjusting the wake-up period:**

1. **Start with a shorter period**: Begin with a 15-minute wake-up period and gradually increase it by 5-10 minutes every few days until you reach your desired wake-up time.
2. **Listen to your body**: Pay attention to your body's response to the wake-up light and adjust the period accordingly. If you're feeling groggy or struggling to wake up, you may need to adjust the period or start with a shorter duration.
3. **Be consistent**: Stick to your wake-up routine and adjust the period consistently to help regulate your sleep-wake cycle.

By starting with a shorter wake-up period and gradually increasing it, you can help your body adjust to the new wake-up time and establish a consistent wake-up routine. Remember to listen to your body and adjust the period accordingly to ensure a gentle and natural wake-up experience.
